ingredients.text: flour (I swap 2 tbsps with buckwheat flour)
butter or oil (I use coconut oil)

steps.text: Prepare two large bowls, a spoon, manual or electric whisk and all ingredients.
In a large bowl mix all dry ingredients.
Separate whites from yolks. Drop the yolks into the dry ingredients. Pour the whites into your second bowl.
Mix your yolks with dry ingredients while slowly pouring milk/mylk. You should obtain a thick pancake batter.
Whip whites until stiff. Next gently fold them into the mixture.
Heat a lightly oiled frying pan over medium high heat.
Cook until bubbly, turn and cook for 1-2 more minutes.
